intro: Sekanama, commonly known as the "crown of the forest," is a tropical plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pink or red flowers. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments, such as rainforests and along stream banks. Its roots are used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and healing properties. The sekanama plant plays a significant role in the ecological balance of its habitat due to its ability to support various forms of wildlife.
